intro: Adenocalymma comosum, commonly known as the silky flax or silky everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features slender, wiry stems covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft, fluffy appearance. Its leaves are linear and often covered in a similar silken coating, contributing to its ornamental value. Adenocalymma comosum is often grown in gardens for its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
